author: Abbey25
title: Receptionist
body:
Received a call from the surgery in the afternoon. My wife tried to answer the call but as she is disabled by the time she reached to pick up the call, the phone stopped ringing, I immediately rang the surgery straight back. I requested to speak to the person who had contacted me yesterday. I was told by the receptionist that no one had been in touch. My wife had spoken to that person and explained that I was not available and will be able to speak to them again tomorrow. The receptionist said that there were no notes and no calls recorded.  
They wouldn’t let me speak to the manager or the Asthma nurse who had made the call. I have had similar incidents before. Doctors and Nurses are excellent. Unfortunately in my experience receptionists give organisations a bad name. I hope something gets done about this issue. If this continues, people will loose patience who bring income to the practice. I believe this is a training issue.

author: MCON00
title: This appointment system is discriminatory
body:
My dad has Alzheimers which is at a very distressing stage for him. He's a very proud and private man who lives alone. He doesn't have carers going in and there is no support for him aside from what we as family do at a distance. The GP knows this is his diagnosis and that he lives alone. He is even on a special register saying he has Alzheimers.  
He is doing his best to maintain his independence and his dignity.The appointment system now in place makes it impossible for him to do so. It makes it impossible for him to get a GP appointment because he can't use the phone anymore because of this illness. He hasn't used his landline for 2 years because it confuses and then distresses so much.  
We told the practice he couldn't use the phone anymore 18 months ago when we raised concerns about how he was being turned away at the desk. Said then it's policy to refuse to make appointments in person. Now they have the telephone triage which says all patients are required to phone for an appointment and then be phoned back to see if any appointment is permitted. For all appointments not just urgent same day.  
So, he as a now disabled man can't make appointments to see his GP. He has a heart condition, he has had prostate cancer, he has depression.  
Society is judged upon how we treat our most vulnerable.  
This is how he is treated by his NHS GP.

author: sunkp39
title: Prostate problems treatment
body:
Enlarged prostate diagnosis, testing (biopsy), MRI (2 so far), consultations, low level prostate cancer found (to-date still within prostate thankfully).  
For the first 65 years of my life, I had no medical problems that involved hospitals. Even visits to a GP were rare. Sure, as my wife and I had two growing children, we all had the occasional coughs and colds during the winter seasons. But thankfully, for both of us, that was about it. The 'kids' are all grown up now with one side having their own two children. So my wife and I became grandparents.  
When I reached just over age 65, I noticed some of what I thought were 'minor changes'. Being a typical man, I ignored them and 'soldiered on' so to speak. I am self-employed, so if I didn't work, then I didn't earn -- so that was another factor that would affect things going forward. Health issues get in the way of work.  
As time went on, originally, I progressively found problems not being able to urinate normally. I even laughed about this myself at times. However, I was to learn that what might be funny in the short term, could if left 'untreated' soon become uncomfortable, then annoying, then painful, then extremely painful, and if not dealt with relatively quickly at that stage, would become life threatening. Normal healthy human kidneys keep producing urine non-stop, which of course has to be let go regularly, or we die.  
In due course, one of the GPs at Portree Medical Centre confirmed my prostate was indeed larger than it should be. So I was also booked in for various follow-up tests at Raigmore Hospital. A prostate biopsy (not a fun day for that one), plus a little later, an MRI scan. So these were done. In addition to having an enlarged prostate, some low-level prostate cancer was also found thankfully still contained inside the prostate.  
I learned that a large prostate did not automatically mean prostate cancer and that having a small or normal-sized prostate did not mean there was no prostate cancer. So if we didn't already know, prostate woes are not straightforward. Nevertheless, the wonderful Urology team at Raigmore Hospital know their stuff.  
In relation to the prostate cancer detected I was advised to take a 'watch and wait' approach. So this meant leaving a blood sample every 3 months and having an MRI once a year. Portree Medical Centre is so good at reminding me to keep these appointments for which I am grateful.  
Not being able to urinate sufficiently was attributed to an enlarged prostate pinching the urethra. My troublesome large prostate meant I wasn't urinating sufficiently, which of course causes other problems too. During the coming months on multiple occasions, I would need a catheter valve fitted when the problem became too much to cope with. I was prescribed Tamsulosin pills to help with the urethra narrowing. These can help over time but can take many months to even start to work.  
Over time, the problem did indeed gradually get worse. It seemed my prostate just kept growing. Several times, several visits to Portree Medical Centre, and the first emergency visit to Broadford Hospital, meant that I had to have a catheter valve fitted yet again. Before the catheter valve was fitted, driving to Broadford Hospital 30 miles away when suffering extreme pain (my own fault for leaving things too long and sticking my head in the sand so to speak) was an additional trial: I had to 'pull the car in' several times on route in an attempt to relieve the pressure. To be honest, I probably shouldn't have been driving but I was in such pain I felt I could do it okay -- eventually. Thankfully, I arrived okay - but in ever increasing waves of pain due to not being able to urinate properly.  
Unfortunately, at that time, Broadford Hospital was short-staffed, and a local car accident seemed to have occurred at about the same time, so naturally took greater priority. As a result, I was not seen for about 3 hours: I was close to passing out. I had to keep visiting the toilet close by -- with not much luck every time. So seconds or minutes later the pain would return and I would need to repeat the process. But of course, it didn't work. I thought the doctor on duty had forgotten I was there and no one seemed to be aware of my obvious distress or checking if I was okay. I didn't like to make a fuss as I didn't know how the car accident situation was developing, but things seemed pretty relaxed further down the ward. Eventually, I think I was reaching my limit: feeling dizzy and nauseous, I had to ask for help or I would simply have to lie down on the ward floor (being horizontal seemed to help a little). A nurse eventually fitted a catheter valve: the relief was ... memorable.  
While I found catheter valves uncomfortable and strange, the relief from the pain of not being able to urinate overshadowed the drawbacks. This time, I only had the catheter valve in place for a few weeks. The idea was to test whether I could cope without it. So the catheter valve was removed again and I returned home. At around that time, I also thought I had pulled a muscle in my back which got really painful over a few days. I then noticed an extensive rash on my lower back right side. So I imagined I must have somehow torn a ligament or something. A visit to our local GP confirmed it was Shingles, not a torn ligament. Later I guessed that the Shingles outbreak might have been brought on by the extreme stress (that I seemed to deny was a problem) of multiple urination problems. Up to that point, I had never had Shingles before so it was another new unwelcome experience for me to discover and learn about.  
Continual urination problems combined with me ignoring or denying to myself that there was a problem I couldn't cope with, meant yet another emergency hospital visit to Broadford Hospital to have a catheter valve reinserted (fourth time I think). On this visit, there were two simply outstanding young ladies who helped enormously: one was a doctor and one a nurse. They were so professional, helpful, kind, considerate. This time, the catheter would be in place for about 3 months. Along with a high strength antibiotic injection and a course of antibiotic pills -- I imagine this was to resolve the effects of UTI, the Shingles, and ongoing urination problems. A few weeks later, the Shingles gradually lessened and got better.  
Though only after taking a couple of these new pills, one of the pain killer medicines reacted with another one I was taking, so I had to stop taking that. This meant essentially putting up with the Shingles pain. A few nights the pain was so bad I had to sleep on the sofa leaning at a strange angle. My wife tells me due to the constant Shingles pain I was moaning most nights but I don't recall that (maybe I blanked it out).  
Earlier, my GP suggested trying an additional drug called Finasteride -- to help shrink the prostate. While I didn't like the sound of it, at this stage, I simply didn't care: anything to shrink my prostate monster would get my vote. Like Tamsulosin, Finasteride takes time to work. So I took one Tamsulosin pill and one Finasteride pill every day while the catheter valve was in place. I was careful to make sure to follow all the guidelines and change the valve myself every week, from the supply our Portree District Nurses kindly provided.  
My GP also told me that later once the Finasteride had time to reduce the prostate a little, I would probably need an operation later to widen the urethra. There were various options for this -- I wasn't looking forward to any of them but accepted that if it was needed, then I would just have to choose one option and keep my fingers crossed.  
Unfortunately, while having the catheter valve in place, I seemed to pick up multiple urinary tract infections regularly which are no fun. A burning sensation while urinating doesn't help, but drinking more water seems counterintuitive as you have to urinate more -- so initially, you get more burning sensations. However, for me, I knew that if I stuck to it, the problem would ease sooner. The quicker I could do that, the better. So I just got on with it. I chose to simply drink more water to help flush these UTIs out. Usually, within a few days, that would indeed work. I must have had 5 or 6 of these 'UTI infections' over the 3-month period. I also found that some foods caused more problems: so I soon found out when I had too much coffee or any food with spices in it were definite no-nos.  
About three months later, it was agreed that we should remove the catheter valve to test whether I could manage without it. So that was done. At this stage, while I was keeping my fingers crossed, I could imagine having to go back in within days to have the catheter re-fitted. However, much to my relief (a word I grew to use a lot), I found that I could urinate normally again. I almost couldn't believe it! In addition, since the prostate appeared to have shrunk, it seems I could eat normally again. I could drink more than a single cup of coffee per day again and tolerate some foods with spices in with no effects whatsoever. Which was nice -- and another relief. It's been months now without any further problems urinating.  
When it was time to have an online 'catch-up consultation', the consultant suggested that the combination of Tamsulosin and Finasteride tends to only work in a small number of cases. Plus, some people can have intolerable side effects from either one or both drugs. Thankfully, I hadn't noticed any real side effects from either drug or their combination. So the consultant surgeon told me 'I was lucky'. So while being somewhat grateful for that reality, I hadn't quite worked out yet what that meant. As a result, it seemed I wouldn't need to have a 'urethra-widening' operation after all. At least for now. So he asked if I wanted to be taken off the list. Once I realised that I wouldn't need to have a laser blasting a wider gap inside my penis in the near future, it was a good day.  
It seems that both Tamsulosin and Finasteride are 'cheap to manufacture' drugs and can be taken long term. So that's where we are right now. No urination problems any more (touch-wood), no catheter valve, and two drugs that seemed to have fixed my problem -- for now at least. So yes, grateful, relieved (there it is again).  
Once a year, I've been advised to have an MRI to keep an eye on the 'low-level prostate cancer'. So I just had another one of those and am awaiting results. Usually, if there's nothing of significance to report, I may not get any automatic feedback. However, if I don't, I might just phone up and ask anyway. Otherwise, my imagination may start running with wild nightmares.  
So an appropriate ending for now is, phew!

title: Total lack of service
body:
If you waste your time trying to get an appointment they will tell you to call at 8am instead of being able to sleep after being up all night. 
You call at 8am and their system says their queue is full and cuts you off every time you try for forty minutes. 
You then trg the other number given for automated booking and it says it is not available. 
 You keep calling the first number and eventually get to a ridiculously long queue and so choose a call back.
 They call you back to say they are fully booked and to call back next week to go through it all again.  
Will not take complaints and say has to be in writing.
  This is done to put you off and reduce number of complaints as they know that a lot of people won't bother.  Absolute garbage.

title: Cannot get an appintment
body: Called 160 times between 08:30 and 09:00 to be constantly told they had very high call volumes and couldn’t contact me to the queue. Guess I’ll have to call 111 then.

title: Great Practice
body: My experience was very good with my medical health review being very clear. My queries were fully answered in very clear terms.

title: Great Practice
body: After not feeling well for a while I did the dreaded call to the doctors I was number 21 in qué took 8 mins which wasn't bad at all. I didn't expect to get an appointment but I spoke to a lovely lady who made me relax as I felt quite upset and up tight she was lovely. I got a telephone appointment that day. I spoke to a lovely doctor who went through all kinds of things at the end of the call I felt like I was getting somewhere to finally start feeling better. This morning I had a txt message saying book a telephone appointment. So I called again and was 6th in qué didn't take long this time I had a lovely lady again not sure if she was the same as the first but both were so nice and friendly we were even laughing on phone this morning. She sorted me out with an appointment within the next 2 weeks. I very rarely go to the doctors I'm a strong believer in not taking up appointments because I have just sneezed. But my experience was very very good from start to finish and in between. Thankyou so much Paula x sorry if there are spelling mistakes ect

title: Hopeless
body: I requested an appointment over 3 weeks ago. No one will let me book over the phone and I've been sent two appointment dates that I couldn't possibly attend. The latest one I only had 12 hours notice via a txt saying 'a reminder about your appointment ' well I'm not in the country at the moment! They must get a lot of DNAs with this method. No idea if the doctor would've been able to help as I don't seem to be able to see one.

title: Disgusting
body:
Caller number one, been on hold for half hour for it to say default and hang up, rang back and another half hour still waiting to be answered. Never get appointment straight away always need the dr to call first. Ridiculous save time and get appointments! Always receptionist on the desk but can’t seem to answer the calls, to busy having coffee and chatting! 
Needing a prescription but because I’ve not long had some can’t order more until a certain date. Honestly wouldn’t recommend this surgery to anyone unless you want to be messed about

title: Aftercare treatment.
body:
Having had a knee replacement at Wrightington hospital last week, on leaving the hospital I was given a letter to ask the surgery to remove my stitches out on the 2nd May.
On phoning this practice I was informed " we don't remove stitches sweetie, you'll have to go to the hub or bath street sweetie". I tried to get an appointment at both facility's only to be told they had no appointments for a month. Surely I should be able to see a nurse at my doctor's to get stitches removed. There are nurses there who can do various other things do why not removing stitches ? I now have to travel back to Wrightington to get the stitches removed. To say that the staff at  Wrightington were shocked that there's nowhere in Warrington to get my stitches removed is an understatement. When your in pain as I am you would think you could get help for your  medical center. 
I hope that you will look into getting this s sorted so no other patient from this practice has to go through the same upset as I have.
Regards, Patricia Robinson.

title: Very efficient and helpful
body:
My daughter woke up with a painful ear and we were due to go on holiday the next day so I was concerned. I filled in the e consult and the Gp rung me back less than an hour later offering me a same day appointment that didn’t interfere with her school day. My husband took her and they saw the nurse practitioner who examined her and prescribed medication, thankfully it wasn’t an inner ear infection and we could still travel. I was immensely thankful that they arranged everything so quickly and were very reassuring taking the stress out of the situation. 
This isn’t the only time the practice have been helpful, I admit the telephone system can have long waits at times but the e consult is easy to use and I have always had appointments arranged in a timely manner, often if I explain that my children are at school or I am working certain days they have worked round this. 
I find the GPs and nurse practitioners helpful and approachable. I have family in the Bromley area under different surgeries and they have struggled with appointments and some even have to queue outside their surgery for appointments at 8am. 
I just wanted to thank the team for all their hard work.

title: Listened to me
body: I am not someone that ever wants to come to the doctor. It takes a lot. I felt listened to today. I did not feel trivialised. I am grateful for that.

title: Excellent practice
body: I've been with this practice for 11 years. The reception staff have always managed to book appointments within the time period I need them. The practitioners have provided a sympathetic ear to all my questions and concerns. Thank you!

title: Very good treatment and after care
body: I have been attending as an outpatient for 2 years and have received excellent care from diagnosis to treatment. The staff work very hard under difficult circumstances but look after the patients and are always wiling to answer any questions

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unprofessional reception staff; good doctors
body: Reception staff can be terribly unprofessional. I just had one of them literally hang up on me after waiting 30 min in the queue. Unacceptable. Doctors, on the other hand, are diligent.

title: Terrible service
body:
You hold on a line for an ages.
GP job is to see a patient and have face to face conversation not a useless phone consultation or send a picture.
This isn't "pandemic" time.
I can't see our kids medical history online even if they are added to his account.
We can't see our history form previous medical practices as well.
When we have an appointment for us or kids in hospital, dentist etc. we can't say what illness was it and when.
I tried to book an appointment for my wife for her scan results and they said this is available Thursday only.
GP must explain patient test results every day not Thursday only.
This medical practice is the worst practice what we used.

title: Great Practice
body: I would like to pass on my thanks to all the staff at Edgwick Medical Centre. My interactions have been very positive and the care I received has been excellent. I would especially like to thank the individuals dealing with repeat prescriptions and referrals/fit notes. Keep up the good work!

title: On line service great
body: Second time I’ve used NHS app to message practice. Both times I have received responses on same day & received help needed. Wonderful!

title: Efficient, professional and friendly
body: I have never been to RSCH before but was so impressed from the moment I entered the door.  As I was looking on the map in the entrance a member of staff showed me where I needed to go.  The receptionist was friendly and helpful, the breast surgeon and nurse could not have been more professional, friendly and helpful, scanning was fast and efficient and follow up on the day was professional.  I was out within an hour.  Great service.  Congratulations to the whole team.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Worst service, refused tests, poor service
body: I went for blood tests and they refused to do the tests because I had the 'wrong form', and sent me back to my GP. My GP confirmed the form was correct and sent me back to them. How can a medical professional be so unknowledgeable and inconsiderate? We pay so much money in tax, so I expect them to do their job properly. They wouldn't book me back in for another week; now I have to take time off again and this is also delaying other tests for me. No apology or slightest sign that they acknowledge they've messed up!  Wasted 3 hours, took time of work, and wasted money on transport. Was on the phone to them waiting for 30 mins, only for them to tell me they can't do anything. Complete disrespect and disregard for patients and their time & money.

title: Exceptional & compassionate care
body: My twin brother had been under the care of the NHS for several years and was always happy with the care and attention he received. He spent the last days in intensive care and was always so well attended. The staff were exceptional and he was happy and content and joking until the end thanks to the amazing doctors and nurses who even sang happy birthday just days before he passed. Their care extended to our family and friends and they always kept my brother and us well informed about his condition. Thank you to the other departments who also cared for him before his transfer to ICU.

title: Disappointing
body:
On several occasions I have found the Reception staff to be very rude and aggrivated.
I suffer with anxiety and struggle making phone calls so to be spoken to in the manner they do is really upsetting. 
I was advised to use E Consult and when telling them I wasn't able to find a slot suitable for my needs I was told 'you must be doing it wrong' 
I understand and sympathise the Receptionsts have a tough and stressful job however taking it out on the patients who are kind and calm really isn't fair.

title: Poor receptionists
body: Called in today as hone line would not let me join cue. When receptionist come I said about my wife's medication was up for review and tried phoning you and says not a valid request she replied there's only two of us on and 8 in the cue on the phone. I don't expect to be spoken to like that I have go out of my way to address the problem which once again is there fault I have not had a medication review in nearly 3 years what a shambles the are

title: Just how treatment should be
body: I have age related Macular degeneration, and am having treatment at Spa Medica in Romford. I’ve recently attended for my 8 th treatment.  The staff couldn’t be more friendly , efficient, and caring. I don’t wish this problem on anybody, but if your unfortunate to suffer it, Go to spa medica, 11 out of 10

title: Good Practice
body: Difficult to get an appointment but when you can they help as much as possible and treatment is good

title: No appointments. No call backs. No care available
body:
Once you get through to the surgery in the morning there are no appointments available. Your told to call back in the afternoon or the next day and when you get through no appointments. 
I've been trying to get an appointment for the past week. 
I've also tried getting in contact using engage consult. Again no one responds. 
In desperation I've been to a&e who have advised the scans I need have to be ordered by a GP. Yet I can not get a GP from this surgery to call me let alone see me. 
It's the worst surgery I've ever had.

title: Outstanding care
body:
In my opinion Woodside is an exceptional practice. I am lucky enough not to have to bother the Drs much, but in the last month I have outstanding care.I had a telephone call with a male dr who didn’t rush me and was sympathetic and caring. Then unfortunately I mislaid my meds and as I was going on holiday telephoned reception and was greeted with a very helpful receptionist called Mary, who was empathetic and helpful. The duty Dr kindly issued me a script all within 1 hour.I know how busy all the staff are and appreciated the care and kindness. 
Well done Woodside

title: Amazing care in day surgery unit
body: I had a day surgery operation on the 28/04/23 for carpal tunnel and cannot fault the care and service I received from the lovely, kind and compassionate nurses and health care assistants in the afternoon day by surgery unit. What a lovely team of people they are and I felt like I was in a private hospital. I was very well looked after     and want to say thank you.

title: Caring service
body:
I called the surgery very distressed and the receptionist was extremely caring and empathetic. She referred me to there social care worker who contacted me quickly and was able to help. 
I felt so pleased I had dealt with a human and not a robot.

title: Lack of care and empathy
body: After calling 111 due to experiencing bleeding in early pregnancy. I was greeted with at first a two hour wait. After 3 hours checked with the receptionist to be told it’s a sit and wait service despite the severity of the situation. I appreciate the stretches in the NHS but, in maternity any bleeding you need to be seen immediately. There was no care, or sympathy for the situation. The urgent care need to change the way they do things and prioritise cases better.

title: Great experience with our little boy
body: Today we visited the childrens ward at west cumberland hospital for a blood test for our 2 year old little boy, the appointment was on time and all staff were great with him they put him at ease were friendly and had great facilities in the room to keep him occupied so thank you so much!

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Disappointed
body: I went in for my appointment, I arrived 15 mins early I waited 45 mins, there were 2 people in front of me when the last person left I was kept waiting for over 15 mins even though no one else was in, I had to leave in the end because my husband had to go to work so never got to see the doctor, not at all happy

title: Worst GP practice
body: Never get appointments when you need the most or really sick and weak. No compassion as a medical practice. It feels like they run a private practice rather then NHS

title: Absolute joke
body: My doctor sent me there as I have swelling on my head and he was really worried but when I get there it was 3 hours for triage then they gave me paracetamol when I've been taking codydramol and tramadol with no affect then they tell me it's about 7 hours to be seen so I came home with more of a headache than I went with it's an absolute joke of a service

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great doctors
body: It’s a great practice, however the waiting times are sometimes off, not all the time just some of the time I don’t really mind personally but others do. I would recommended it because I personally like the practice it’s very professional and welcoming however it could do with a splash of colour so it’s not as daunting for younger children.

title: Unlucky timing I would say
body:
After checking in, quite rapidly took the blood sample and left. Around 2h later shift changed and new patients arrived, were initially examined and taken in by doctor within half an hour where’s me and another patient clearly in severe pain sat waiting. 5h in asked for update and it took an hour to get one gentleman who’s been sat for nearly 8h finally got attention, got iv and sent to ct. after I finally got exam it, been told you’ll get painkillers and come back tomorrow for CT scan, when asked if I can get it on the day been advised we will call you 2h prior, no time slot given, means I will have to travel, wait countless hours and pay parking fees. The nurses and receptionists were great, doctor - can’t tell. Maybe need another 8h in waiting room to get dose of painkillers. If you take the patient, get it done there and then, diagnose. Don’t make people do unnecessary travels because you can prescribe painkillers to get the patient off the chest. I’d rather diagnose myself using google and come to the hospital to get it sorted or let nurse do it, doctors just... I’ve no words, disappointed. Nurses do the heavy lifting, I don’t understand they are just as qualified in fact I can bet nurses are better at doing IVs than doctors because they do it all the time where’s doctor looks at you, scribbles something down or better yet gives you paracetamol and sends you to another place to deal with you. 
To add a little bit more, every single sanitizer dispenser I tried using was empty - from entrance to ward 34

title: Great Doctors, awful telephone system
body: Like everyone else is saying. The telephone system is so so bad. How in 2023 is a telephone system this poor. If anything. Why don't you do callbacks even? I know the NHS are really under pressure which is something I'm aware of and that they're doing their best but in 2023 this is diabolical. I was at a old practice and never had phone line issues like this. This needs to be sorted out. Sorry to be harsh but it's 2023 not 2003. People need all the help that they need. What happens if something bad was to occur to someone and there's no answer or you denying the opportunity for an appointment. Very frustrated. Doctors are so good though. They're helpful, but the telephone lines and people behind them. Not helpful at all.

title: Brilliant service
body:
Yet another great experience with my GP. Not rushed at all, felt fully informed and offered choices. I’ve been a patient at Glebe for most of my life and can honestly say I have never had a problem. Great team of clinical staff and receptionists. Most GPs work incredibly hard, but these GPs are providing the best service and care to their patients and I can’t imagine how CQC have rated this a “requires improvement” practice. I get offered an appointment any time I call, any referrals, blood tests, prescriptions, all handled efficiently and safely for me and my family. 
CQC should be ashamed of the pressure they are placing on brilliant surgeries like this one. It makes a sham of the process. Clearly patient experience doesn’t matter to them, it’s a tickbox exercise and it will ruin good GPs if the process doesn’t change. Ignore this surgery’s rating. They couldn’t work harder for their patients and me and my family appreciate the care they provide very much. Thank you Glebe family practice! Your hard work is appreciated!

title: Good old fashioned appointments
body: Why can't we have a good old fashioned system where we get to see a doctor? I am fed up of no one answering the phone online texts etc before I can even get to see a GP. I just want an appointment  thats all. I feel so sorry for people who are not used to the jnternet as I am getting older I feel scared that we can't access these services. It feels like we as patients are not cared about.

title: Excellent care
body: I have recently had a problem with my hip. and, as with every medical problem I and my family have had in the 50+ years we have been with this surgery, I have had excellent care.  Not only have the staff been caring, but they have taken the time to explain my problem and discuss the options with me.  I have been seen quickly and treated with respect and good temper by all the staff, including the receptionists.  Full marks for Rosedean Surgery.

title: GP practice
body:
I was informed via text and on patient access app that the GP would ring me at 09.50, he rang at 09.34 hence I missed the call.
GP sent text informing me that I need repeat urine and blood test.
Rang surgery straight back to be informed that due to me having missed the call the GP could not ring me back stating that whoever had sent me the time should have given me a timeframe not an exact time.
Appointment then made for repeat blood test.

title: Still using covid as an excuse for phone…
body: Contacted surgery for an appointment was given a triage call and told doctor would phone after 2mths still no better eventually got to see a doctor had blood tests then ended up at Russell's Hall hospital. This could have been sorted at the beginning.

author: MsDowney
title: Outstanding appointment for my mum
body:
My elderly mum had an appointment today with Rehanna. She was outstanding, very patient with mum as mum is quite hard of hearing.  
She made us feel so welcome very friendly as all the staff were..  
My mum looks forward to going in as they are all so friendly.  
Rehanna is a star well done for making mum feel so special..  
Best wishes from a very happy daughter

author: eaglezm54
title: I found the work helpful
body: I heard about Telford STaRS from a teacher regarding my addiction. I was given a 1-1 worker and they offered different things to stop/cut down. I also had harm reduction advice. I found the work helpful but decided to not quit. Found it helpful and found what I got offered in service was beneficial.

title: Strength to strength
body: Really genuinely cant fault the service, the econsult system is brilliant, when I was having some difficulty getting through, I sent a request through econsult. Two hours later got a phone from nurse, and was seeing the Doctor in the afternoon. Treated very nicely by polite reception staff and Doctor took time catching up with me properly. Excellent, and they definitely deserve to be acknowledged as an excellent example of NHS.

title: Superb efficient service
body: Urgent visit on a Bank holiday Saturday for accidental injury.Was seen and triaged quickly. Treated and sutured within two hours.absolutely well impressed.Thanks so much to everyone that were involved.

title: Great practice
body: When you have mastered patches it is very good. Large number of doctor available. Good support staff. Patches not always ready available. Reseptonist OK.

title: The Best practice
body: Saddlers health Centre is one of the best practices. Attentive and cooperative staff and they care about their patients.

title: Superb ladies
body: MRI dept  Watford hospital I was terrified ladies in this department were so kind and one held my hand the whole time I would not have done it without her I had to have cage over face and I suffer with claustrophobia she was an angel thankyou so much these are ladies who deserve our support

title: Extremely Efficient
body: I was referred to Eye Emergency by my Optician following retinal detachment. From the moment I first attended and booked in with the Receptionist until I was signed off by the Consultant post Op I received superbly professional, friendly and helpful support from Admin and Clinical staff alike. I can’t fault any element of the service I received from with communication or clinical delivery and my case was dealt with incredibly swiftly. Thank you for making it all quite a ‘painless’ experience in so many ways.

title: Great appointment
body:
Thank you to the dietician for a positive and reassuring appointment. It was reassuring to know my diet was appropriate. You gave me some useful advice which I am following. I have bought a squat stool and am finding it very helpful.
I feel I had an extremely helpful appointment. She was obviously very knowledgeable and listened to me. I was treated with respect at all times. She acknowledged that everyone responds differently to certain foods with IBS.
Thank you for your help and care. I will highly recommend this service to others

title: Redhouse Radlett - great service
body: Urgently needed to speak to my GP. Called chatted to the person I believe is the practice manager. Was very helpful, and assured me he would consult with my GP ref my medical needs - I had just returned from hospital had a MRI scan - bad back injury- now in body brace. Dr called a little later and helped with getting my pain etc medication script to Boots within a few hrs. Great compassionate service Thank you.

title: Amazing antenatal care from start to delivery
body: Living in Epping I was placed with the midwife team based in St Margarets hospital. I saw the same midwife throughout my pregnancy and as luck would have it she was even the midwife that delivered my baby, at my planned home birth. 2 other amazing midwives also attended my birth I felt extremely at ease. My birth was amazing and empowering. Everyone that I met at PAH and St Margarets were fully supportive of my birth choices. Everything went smoothly scan appointments, midwife appointments and even blood appointments. Thank you so much to everyone.

title: Great family practice
body: My family is with this surgery for the last 7 years. The doctor and the staff are excellent. Appointments are available most of the times.

title: Wonderful service
body: We called an ambulance on a busy Saturday morning at The Country Park as my mum had collapsed, and thankfully they arrived so promptly and took complete control in a kind, compassionate and efficient manner. They continued to show complete professionalism whilst caring for my mum in the back of the Ambulance.  It makes you realise what a precious service we have and this most definitely needs more investment and better pay to retain the wonderful staff, and allow them to meet all the demands made upon them!  Thankyou so much.

title: Great Practice
body: Extremely happy with my local GP practice, very friendly and anyways make time to understand your issues and concerns and discuss options available.

title: Great Practice
body:
4 visits to Spa ( 2 mine 2 husband) All extemely efficient - staff very friendly and professional- treatment all painless, quick and good discharge information
Suggest you run the nhs- their left hand does not know what  the right one is doing

title: Outstanding team
body: Everyone at Park House Surgery is great!  They go out of their way to help.  Appointments are made easilly and their processes are transparent.  I give thanks to all the team at Bagshot.

title: A Great Stay
body: My two weeks stay for physio rehabilitation could not have been bettered. The whole staff all the way down the line were most caring and helpful.   To leave so much more mobile than when I started is testament, not only to the wonderful physio team, but also to everyone who contributed to making the stay a very friendly experience.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful staff & care.
body: I was referred to A&E by the 111 service with suspected DVT yesterday. Arrived at just before midday, was seen practically straightaway by Triage & from then on there was hardly any waiting to be seen by subsequent staff. They were all extremely lovely kind people that did their utmost to make me feel at ease. Even though the Doctor couldn't get me fitted in for a scan (I have to return Tuesday) he gave me medication to see me through till then. What wonderful caring staff you have in your A&E dept.

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service and practise
body: A procedure well done in the surgery. Thanks to all but particularly the doctor performing the procedure.

title: 4 fantastic visits
body: Being collected by your transport and taken from Wales to Liverpool and back again was a fantastic help and the drivers were wonderful. The staff at the hospital were so professional and attentive all along the way. Nothing too much trouble. Great surgeon and operation done so slickly that it was finished before I knew it!!Thank you so much.

title: Excellent service
body:
Excellent service from all staff members present, very organised and run on time with no delays. 
I would recommend this practice to anyone else who requires a Covid vaccination or any other treatment or appointment for medical attention.

title: excellent Practice
body: From the minute you enter SpaMedica the staff are so efficient and friendly.The whole procedure runs smoothly and the final results are fantastic. Thank you surgeons your work is apppreciated.

title: Exemplary Treatment
body: I attended the clinic for treatment and I was dealt with efficiently and well. The staff are friendly and welcoming and the procedure was explained clearly by the doctor. Thank you to all who work in the department.

readBy.name: James Paget University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: General Surgery
body: Had my Gallbladder removed . The experience and care and professionalism i received from arrival to discharge was exemplary.  All the Consultants, Nurses ,were friendly, helpful, and understanding.  Thankyou

title: Five Star Service
body:
Five Star Service
Recently discharged after spending five days on ward 2.
My experience of pre and post operative care was excellent. I have nothing but praise and gratitude for the hospital, it's staff and the departments that supported me through an unexpected period of illness.
I must also give a special thank you to the fantastic Colorectal surgical team who cared for me every step of the way.
Thank you Airedale, much appreciated.

title: New to the practise
body: Having received outstanding support over many years from my local practise in Leeds 16 I was reluctant to change after moving to Leeds 8. Once I understood the receptionists have been trained in Triage I was very happy with them arranging my contact with a gp. They have been unfailingly helpful. The pharmacist has been really helpful too in sorting out medication and the direct gp contact extremely positive.

title: Great staff
body: Have had nothing but good experiences from the staff and the conjoining day Lewis pharmacy. The staff go above and beyond to manage how they can with the resources they have. They deserve so much more funding than they currently receive. I have had many issues with conjoining services and today one of the staff on reception personally called my clinic to tell them they had sent the wrong document because I had been telling the clinic for a long time. Anytime I have an issue they listen and try their best to resolve it. I had an emergency the day before my first day of work and they managed to send it to a pharmacy near my place of work so I could access it and felt better on my first day. They work so hard and deserve more recognition.

title: Fantastic service
body: I was sent here by 111 for help with a minor injury over the weekend that needed medical attention. The receptionist was very friendly and had agreed with 111 that I would be accepted and remembered the conversation when I arrived. I was seen and treated within 45 minutes and on my way home. Fantastic service from the start with 111 to being treated here.

title: Excellent Care
body: I was in A&E and Larch AMU for 2 nights recently. Excellent care. Every Doctor Nurse and member of staff couldn’t have been more efficient and helpful. Thank you.

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Really pleased about the prompt contact through econsultation. Very helpful staff both clinical and admin! Thank you for all your help.

title: Fabulous care and professionalism. Thank you
body:
I went into the GWH for total hip replacement on 28th April. Right from the start every member of staff I had contact with showed concern, kindness, consideration, and exceptional professionalism.
I felt listened to throughout the whole process and, although I had one or two minor blips along the way with my health, blood pressure, anxiety etc, the staff were knowledgeable in their fields and able to deal with my problems  swiftly, compassionately, confidently and efficiently.
The nurses even helped me with my confidence doing a tiny celebration jig when I achieved a goal, and my carer cleaned up my sick in the busy x-ray department leaving me feeling dignified and cared about - very horrible for him though and all in front of the other people waiting (who were also superb). He was very quick and efficient, sparing me any embarrassment I might have felt otherwise.
The physiotherapists and all staff worked diligently for me, and when I left hospital I felt that I would be able to manage with the clear and comprehensive advice and equipment I had been given.
The food was really nice, especially the lentil and tomato soup. And the carers left everything clean, tidy and hygenic. One carer offered me hot water for my tea bags as she noticed I do not drink ordinary tea - she will recognise herself if she reads this - she helped help me stay feeling understood and cared for - thank you so much!
Throughout my hospital stay I felt confident that someone would come if I called, and confident of the staffs expertise. 
I felt the care I received was fantastic and that I was monitored thoroughly throughout. A huge thank you to everyone who was involved with my surgery, anaesthetic, and recovery. They will know that I am a very anxious patient and I become easily overwhelmed, so I feel they did a fabulous job under difficult circumstances.
I hope my recovery at home now continues smoothly after your excellent care in the GWH. 
Thank you all again!

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb service
body:
After being messed around by my GPS. I went to UTC for a x ray on long standing ankle injury. 
They found it to be broken and rather than sending me back to my GP.
 They looked into my injury and fitted me with a recovery boot.
I have also been referred to virtual Fracture clinic at QA.

Thank you all very much for superb experience. I was even offered a  bottle of water while waiting

title: Great practice
body:
I would like to thank all of the staff in the Minor Injuries Unit who were involved with my care in the last 2 days. They were very kind and professional and I am extremely grateful. 
I am sorry I am not allowed to mention their names here.

title: Well organised, professional practice providing 5…
body:
Recent visit for Covid booster carried out by friendly helpful staff, no waiting, no parking problems well organised.
Have moved around and attended a number of surgeries I would rate Whiteacres as one of the best.
Whiteacres is well managed and provides an excellent level of care provided by professional caring and well organised, friendly staff at all levels.

title: Exceptional care
body:
I have been in the hospital since Sunday 23 April, first at A and E, then through Ambulatory care, Acute assessment 1 and then Victory Ward. Throughout my stay, I have experienced nothing but the very best care. The staff in each department, especially the nurses and Doctors in Acute assessment 1 and Victory Ward are exceptional, kind people who ensure that their patients are given the best care. 
The matron on Victory Ward is a dedicated nurse who really looks after her patients. 
The consultant doctors and the ward doctors are patient and deal with all sorts of people and from my observations treat everyone with respect.
Yes, the waiting has been long, but I cannot allocate blame to anyone. I have been looked after very well, and I think it only fit to thank all of them publicly!
Thank you all so very much, I am humbled by your dedication and care. 
My very best wishes to you all.

title: Well organised, professional practice providing 5…
body:
Recent visit for Covid booster carried out by friendly helpful staff, no waiting, no parking problems well organised.
Have moved around and attended a number of surgeries I would rate Whiteacres as one of the best.
Whiteacres is well managed and provides an excellent level of care provided by professional caring and well organised, friendly staff at all levels.

title: First Time Experience
body:
My very first experience with the NHS was at the St James Medical Practice.  I was expecting an in-person consultation based on the telephone conversation with the staff and the text reminders, but it turned out to be a phone consultation. As it was my first time, I wanted to discuss multiple ailments, and the Physician Associate was very accommodating.

Despite the negative comments I've heard about the NHS, I was very impressed with the service. I was able to do my bloodworks the same day. And, the Physician Associate called me back to follow-up on a matter that we discussed.

Overall, a great first experience!

title: Great practice if you see same gp
body: I suffer anxiety and depression amongst medical things and I was seeing dame lady doctor for a while and she was amazing as I never went to doctors for a long time.i was having thoughts in my head etc (not suicidal this time ) but really depressive things and I got a callback from a different doctor and all she said is up your venaflaxine in morning time. I feel like a zombie to start with. 😴

title: Abmost nothing to recommend it.
body: I have over many years lived in five different countries including developing nations and this has to be by far the worst medicaI clinic (and more generally the worst system) I have experienced.  The front desk is diabolical to the extent that one wonders if the people manning it have to pass a 'little dictator' test to get a job.  I have never seen a reception staff member smile or show any sense of empathy. I have seen them refer people 111.   I have had two previous practices in the Uk and none have been particularly good but this one excells.  Getting an appointment is almost impossible, and when you get one it is on the telephone.  I had a previous practice that had a telephone service - you could book a call to a doctor if you had a question about an existing condition - questions about dosages, side effects of new medicine or changes in a condition - matters that didn't need face to face discussion but not telephone appointments.   I recently waited a month for a telephone appointment.  On one occasions I rang up with serious symptoms of an illness and was told to call 111.  I knew that 111 would refer me to a & e so went directly there - instead of a five minute walk to the practice, it was a bus trip to a & e for an illness, though serious, could have been dealt with at the clinic.  And mistakes with prescribing - I won't discuss them here - but they can be quite dire.  Periods left without medication because apparently nobody reads existing medical records.  The doctor I have occasionally got to see, is quite pleasant, but by the time I get to see them I have usually got a diagnosis to give them.  All I need is the appropriate medication and these days I research that before I go too.  I find this limited 8am to 6pm on weekdays service ridiculous.  I am came from a system where the standard opening times for clinics  7am  until 8pm, as well as a Saturday clinic.  In addition there were walk-in 24 hour clinics that were free to all. That seems to be the norm with most comparable western countries, all of whom have national health services although Brits seem to think the Uk Nhs is only one.  And there is no after hours service either.  It's 111 or a & e - no wonder a & e is overused.  I do not know whether this clinic is so poor because it is a reflection of the entire system, but it has major issues and is most certainly in need of an administrative shake-up and some change of attitude.  And perhaps some decent staff training for the frontline staff.

title: Excellent care
body: Recieved excellent care from urgent treatment centre today. Staff are professional, compassionate and competent. It took only 90 minutes to check in and out of the hospital after receiving great care from the team.  You are all amazing!

title: Caring
body: Scared of the cataract surgery - all staff put my mind at rest - hand held during surgery - great people. Surgery was painless as I was told but hope I do not have to go through that again

title: Abrupt Triage Nurse
body: I visited the Walk In Centre due to a loss of hearing. I had tried drops recommend by the Chemist and could only get a phone appointment at my GP’s. The triage nurse was really abrupt informing me that patient’s need to go to their doctors and this is causing issues with their wait times, they tooth my ear temperature, they didn’t ask me if my symptoms, how long I’d had the issue and if l was taking any medication, they dismissed me and told me to go wait in the queue. I understand the pressure on the NHS but they need to remain professional and treat every patient with respect.

title: Excellent Treatment
body: After being fitted with a catheter in A&E, I was asked to visit the TWOC (Try WithOut Catheter) clinic the following week.  The specialist nurses there were kind and sympathetic.  They provided me with tea, soup and a sandwich whilst I spent most of the day in the department.  The treatment I received was exemplary.

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff are very attentive
body:
My time here has been going great although it is long its still going quite well, I knew I was in safe hands from the start as the way I was treated because when I came onto the ward the staff were very welcoming, even though it was extremely busy, the staff were still very attentive and came round to everyone.  
I will be definitely leaving with a positive experience, the care is just brilliant! I can see how hardworking the staff are dealing with everyone especially during times like these when they seem so understaffed, I don't think I'd find it easy to work in a setting like this but they manage to overcome this barrier and carry on which I think deserves so much more than what they are given.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Inefficient, entitled staff
body: Pharmacist is rude and prickly, a typical jobsworth individual. Their 'need' for five working days to fill out a repeat prescription would be hilarious if it weren't so depressing, inconvenient and absurd.Who's paying for whom?

title: Kindness
body: Overall impression was of extreme kindness and professionalism.  Thank you very much for my treatment.

title: Very professional/prompt service from Poole…
body: From the early assessment appointment to the day of my Cateract removal a total of only 27 days .No bruises no pain and in total my visit was 2 hours...I can see perfectly with my Right Eye now I have booked my follow up with Specsavers and look forward to my left eye Cateract being so prompt. Well Done Spa Medica cannot fault.A very Big Thank You. from Suzanne

title: Excellent treatment but hard to get a meeting
body: I have been a patient here for 40 years, and have found this a superb practice, with caring and helpful doctors. But over the past half a dozen years the ability to get an appointment has descended to zero. I now call in personally, smile at the receptionist and get a time to see a doctor. On the phone? Forget it.

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: the cups of tea have been great!
body:
I have been brought up to the Ramone 3 ward a couple days ago and i have to say there isn't much that i can complain about the ward everything has been very good, the bed is quite comfortable now as at the start I was only provided 1 pillow however usually in my beds I like a lot of pillows, the nurses on this ward are amazing as once I told them I would feel a wee bit more comfortable if I had some more pillows they went out of their way to get me more pillows which was very lovely of them and I appreciate it, so now I am able to get a good night’s sleep as I am a lot more comfortable.  
So in my opinion staff are 10/10 not much room for improvement for them. The food that has been provided has also been good, a lot people turn their noses up at hospital food but I have to say I actually have been enjoying it (the cups of tea have been great!). All I can say is too keep up the good work.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Good service when needed
body: I follow the required process and never have a problem getting the necessary service. Always very polite and professional.

title: Great Group GP Practice
body:
I recently entered my 10th decade, and have been a patient of this practice for many, of those decades.

Yesterday I was recalled for an annual review of a medical condition, and received exceptionally caring and professional treatment from a practice nurse, which was completely typical of the care that I routinely receive from my usual doctor, doctor colleagues, nurses, healthcare assistants, paramedics, and reception team.

I am extremely happy and grateful that the Dolphins practice is my GP practice.

title: Great practice
body: Felt very welcome and at ease with mri scan an the glasses they used so could see vr tv help relax more and pass the time

title: Great appointment
body:
Thank you to the dietician for a positive and reassuring appointment. It was reassuring to know my diet was appropriate. You gave me some useful advice which I am following. I have bought a squat stool and am finding it very helpful.
I feel I had an extremely helpful appointment. She was obviously very knowledgeable and listened to me. I was treated with respect at all times. She acknowledged that everyone responds differently to certain foods with IBS.
Thank you for your help and care. I will highly recommend this service to others

title: Very good
body:
Very grateful for all that was done for me last Wednesday evening.  Everybody was very kind and sympathetic and I left just after nine o’clock.
Hospital number 702812
Thank you, Alan Smith

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: MG79
title: The one stop approach was very helpful
body:
Very lucky to have the NHS - went to Dr Raj and her menstrual disorder clinic and was received with great care and kept informed about what was happening at all times.  
The nurses were excellent at trying to keep me occupied while the procedure was taking place.  
Aftercare from Dr Raj was helpful too. Will have to return but have information about next steps and felt that the care given was expert and that my knowledge about condition has been improved.  
Thank you - the one-stop approach was very helpful as someone who finds it hard to get time off.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: fantastic hearing care
body: I went to see the audiologist with a whistling hearing aid. After being checked it was wax in my ear that was setting it off. She was fantastic and sorted the problem. She was very caring and professional and I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

title: Awful practice but Excellent GP
body: I felt l needed to get some much needed advice and was pleasantly surprised to come face to face with a fantastic doctor. I've been worried about various ongoing problems and the doctor put my mind at rest. Kind. Patient and extremely helpful. Gave an immediate referral. Thank you.

title: Horrible practice
body: I have just changed practice because this one is just awful, after waiting hours for a Dr to call me it was a pharmacist that called me and after almost an hour interview she promised that I would get some medicine prescription on the same day, after 3 days I am here still waiting and never heard from them again. I am still suffering because can't get treated, this is just one of the reasons I am out of there for good.
